text: Wisdom’s Banquet
Wisdom has built her house;
she has hewn her seven pillars.
She has slaughtered her slaughtering, mixed her wine,
\add and\add* also set her table.
She has sent her servant girls,\f + \fr 9:3 \ft Or “young maidens” \f* she calls
upon the wings of the high places of town,
“Whoever \add is\add* simple, let him turn here.”
As for the one who lacks ⸤sense⸥,\f + \fr 9:4 \ft Literally “heart” \f* she says to him,
“Come, eat with my bread;
drink with the wine I have mixed.
Lay aside simplicity and live;
walk in the way of understanding.”
He who corrects a scoffer gains abuse for himself,
and he who rebukes the wicked ⸤gets hurt⸥.\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Literally “abuse him” \f*
Do not rebuke a scoffer, lest he hate you;
rebuke the wise and he will love you.
Give to a wise one and he will become more wise;
⸤teach⸥\f + \fr 9:9 \ft Literally “make known to” \f* a righteous one and he will increase learning.
Foolishness’ Banquet
The start of wisdom is fear of Yahweh,
and knowledge of the Holy One,\f + \fr 9:10 \ft Or “holy ones” \f* insight.
For by me your days shall increase,
and years of life shall multiply for you.
If you are wise, you are wise for yourself,
and \add if\add* you scoff, alone you shall bear \add it\add*.
A woman of foolishness is loud,
simple, and does not know ⸤it⸥.\f + \fr 9:13 \ft Literally “what” \f*
She sits at the door of her house,
upon a throne \add at the\add* high places of town,
\add in order\add* to call to those who pass by the road,
those who go straight \add on\add* their way:
“Whoever is simple, may he turn here!”
As for he who lacks ⸤sense⸥,\f + \fr 9:16 \ft Literally “heart” \f* she says to him,
“Stolen waters are sweet,
and bread of secrecy is pleasant.”
But he does not know that the dead\f + \fr 9:18 \ft Or “Rephaim” \f* \add are\add* there,
in the depths of Sheol\f + \fr 9:18 \ft A term for the place where the dead reside, i.e., the Underworld \f* \add are\add* her guests.
